title.narrative: Multisector emergency response for IDP, returnee and host communities in Kajo-Keji, CES

description.narrative: With funding from CGF, this project will be implemented in the 3 Payams Kangapo 1, Lire and Nyepo Payam of Kajo-Keji County, CES following recent CTP needs assessment conducted in the Kajo-Keji. The proposed activities will include provision farm inputs (seeds and tools) to most vulnerable households. Establishment of demo plots for practical demonstrations. Farmers will be formed into groups of 20 members for easy provision of extension support and to share experience/ideas. 3 extension agents (seconded from County Agriculture Department) and 6 Agriculture Extension Workers (recruited locally from community) will be trained and deployed to support farmers. WASH activities will focus on rehabilitation of critical boreholes in high priority areas informed by malnutrition and diarrhoea data collected from health facilities. To ensure sustainability, functional fully equipped community-based committees will be established to oversee operations and maintenance of the water supply system. Hygiene promotion will be a key focus and CAFOD will work through community-based hygiene promoter (3 hygiene promoters will be seconded from the CWD and 6 HPVs will recruited at community level to carry out awareness raising campaigns in schools, health facilities, marketplaces and other public places to change bad hygiene practices amongst the community to reduce incidences of diarrhoea and other WASH related diseases. Hygiene promotion will be supplemented with provision of WASH NFIs to most vulnerable households. Accountability of affected population is central to our work. Also, a robust functional complaint and response handling mechanism is in place which offer programme participants opportunity to express their views and their feedback fed to programme on real time to shape the direction of our programme. CAFOD will continue to facilitate community consultation meetings to ensure active community participation, transparency and handling community feedback.
